etymologies: mid 19th century: from Spanish, literally ‘cockle’, based on Latin concha (see conch)

definitions: a soft limestone of broken shells, used in road-making in the Caribbean and Florida.
shortDefinitions: soft limestone of broken shells, used in road-making

definitions: a small bivalve mollusk with a wedge-shaped shell which has a wide variety of colors and patterns.

notes.text: Genus Donax, family Donacidae: several species, including the edible American coquina (D. variabilis)

shortDefinitions: small bivalve mollusc with wedge-shaped shell which has wide variety of colours and patterns
